bibl.title: William Spears and James McGough v King County. Testimony of Plaintiffs.
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

keywords.term: A.E. Hanford James Seavey James Fleass

div1.ab: Territory of Washington County of King | ss.
div1.p: William Spears, and James McGough, each being first duly sworn on oath says: That he is the one of the Plaintiffs named in the above entitled action; that he has heard the foregoing petition read, knows the contents thereof, and believes the same to be true; that he makes this affidavit because ______
div1.ab: Subscribed and sworn to before me this 9th day of November 1883
A E Hanford Notary Public in and for King County, Washington Territory.
Territory of Washington County of King | ss
div1.p: I, JAMES SEAVEY, Clerk of the District Court, holding terms at Seattle, King County, Washington Territory, hereby certify that, the foregoing is a true copy of the ________ in the foregoing entitled cause now on file in my office.
div1.ab: _________ Clerk By ________ Deputy Recieved at Seattle, in King County, Washington Territory, this ____ say of _______ 188__, a true copy of the foregoing.
In the District Court, Third Judicial District, Holding Terms at Seattle

In the Matter of the Application of William Spears and James McGough Plaintiffs For a Writ of VS. Habeas Corpus Defendant Petition Filed Nov 9th 1883 James seavey, Clerk. By James Fleass Deputy. C.H. Hanford Attorneys for Plaintiffs
